definition: Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)

sentences.english: The gastrocnemius and soleus press the sole of the foot into the floor.
sentences.chinese: 腓腸肌和比目魚肌將腳底壓向地板。

sentences.english: Soleus muscle of two lower limbs was harvested at 7 weeks old.
sentences.chinese: 在7周齡時，解剖取出兩下肢的比目魚肌作標本。

sentences.english: The bird enjoyed a dinner of flatfish…
sentences.chinese: 小鳥先津津有味地吞進一條比目魚。

sentences.english: A dextral flatfish lies with the right eye uppermost.
sentences.chinese: 右側比目魚躺着時右邊的眼睛朝上。

sentences.english: I think I'll try the broiled sole.
sentences.chinese: 我想我來一盤烤比目魚。

sentences.english: Warm weather has attracted the flat fish close to shore .
sentences.chinese: 煦暖的氣候將比目魚引到了近海。
五個胖的男修道士在煎比目魚。

sentences.english: The calves are comprised of two muscles: the gastrocnemius and soleus.
sentences.chinese: 小腿肌羣包括腓腸肌和比目魚肌。

sentences.english: The muscular branches of the arteria tibialis posterior mainly distribute to the muscle flexor digitorum longus, and muscle soleus.
sentences.chinese: 脛後動脈的肌支主要分佈於趾長屈肌和比目魚肌。

sentences.english: Flesh of a large european flatfish.
sentences.chinese: 一種歐洲大比目魚的肉。
淡灰白色魚肉的比目魚。

sentences.english: Don't be afraid to ask your fishmonger to fillet flat fish.
sentences.chinese: 儘管叫魚販子把比目魚的魚刺剔掉。

sentences.english: But there came a day when he actually caught two enormous flounders .
sentences.chinese: 但有一天他確實抓了兩條極大的比目魚。

sentences.english: European flatfish highly valued as food.
sentences.chinese: 歐洲非常珍貴的食用比目魚。

sentences.english: Halibut have made a comeback in Alaska.
sentences.chinese: 在阿拉斯加，大比目魚已經恢復。

sentences.english: The gastrocnemius is the larger of the two and lies on top the soleus.
sentences.chinese: 腓腸肌比比目魚肌大，它附着在後者的表面上。

definition: fish maw/a food dish made from the swim bladder of fish
chicken in rice wine/also translated drunken chicken
Cantonese poached chicken, known as "white cut chicken"
rice in gravy, typically with meat and vegetables
katsuobushi or dried bonito flakes (paper-thin shavings of preserved skipjack tuna)
